parameters.name: Subscription
parameters.query:
summarize by subscriptionId
| project value = strcat("/subscriptions/", subscriptionId), label = subscriptionId, selected = iff(subscriptionId =~ '{DefaultSubscription_Internal}', true, false)

content.json: The Simple Search defaults to **all tables** if no tables are selected. The global search works best with short time durations. Longer durations can cause the query to error out. **Select one or more tables for queries over longer durations.** Bug: Selecting a row in the results below may cause your browser to freeze. Note that search results can be exported to Excel.

parameters.name: Tables
parameters.query:
union withsource=TableName1 *
| project Table = TableName1
| distinct Table
| order by Table asc

content.query:
set maxoutputcolumns=5000;
search "{SearchString}"
content.title: Search Results

content.query: search in ({Tables}) "{SearchString}"
content.title: Search Results

content.query:
search "{SearchString}"
| summarize count() by $table
| sort by count_
| project Table=$table, Count=count_
content.title: Summarize Count by Table

content.query:
search in ({Tables}) "{SearchString}"
| summarize count() by $table
| sort by count_
| project Table=$table, Count=count_
content.title: Summarize Count by Table

content.query:
search in ({Tables}) "{SearchString}"
| summarize count() by bin(TimeGenerated, 5m)
| take 10000
content.title: Results Over TIme

content.query:
search "{SearchString}"
| summarize count() by bin(TimeGenerated, 5m)
| take 10000
content.title: Results Over TIme

content.json: **Table Explorer** is designed to help you better understand the data in your tables. Each table, column, and vaule is easily **sorted by volume**.

content.query:
union withsource=TableName1 *
| project _BilledSize, _IsBillable, TimeGenerated, TableName1
| summarize Entries = count(), Size = sum(_BilledSize), last_log = datetime_diff("second",now(), max(TimeGenerated)), estimate  = sumif(_BilledSize, _IsBillable==true)  by TableName1, _IsBillable
| project Table = TableName1, Size = Size
| order by Size desc
content.title: Table Picker
content.noDataMessage: Select a workspace above to begin. Empty workspaces will not work.

content.title: Column Picker
content.noDataMessage: Select a table to list columns

content.query:
{Table}
| summarize count() by tostring({Column})
| project-rename Count=count_
| sort by Count
| take 2000
content.title: Top Records
content.noDataMessage: Select a column to list top records.

content.query:
{Table}
| where {Column} == tostring(parse_json('{Selected}').{Column})
| summarize count() by bin(TimeGenerated, 1h) 
| render timechart
content.title: Hourly Records - Time Brush to see Details
content.noDataMessage: Select a record above

content.title: Related Records

content.query:
SecurityEvent
| extend AType = case(AccountType=="User", "(U)", AccountType=="Machine", "(M)","")
| extend Accounts = strcat(Account, " ", AType)
| summarize count() by Accounts, Account
| project Accounts, Count=count_, replace_string(Account, "\\", "")
| sort by Count desc
| take 1000
content.title: Account Filter
content.noDataMessage: Select a workspace above to list accounts

content.query:
SecurityEvent
| where IpAddress has "."
| summarize count() by IpAddress
| project IpAddress, Count=count_
| sort by Count desc
| take 5000
content.title: IP Filter
content.noDataMessage: Select a workspace above to list accounts

content.query:
SecurityEvent
| extend File = tostring(array_reverse(split(FilePath, "\\")).[0])
| where isnotempty(File)
| summarize count() by File
| project File, Count=count_
| sort by Count
| take 1000
content.title: Process Filter

content.query:
Event
| where EventLevelName contains "{Severity}"
| extend LogSource1 = strcat(EventLog, "-", Source)
| extend LogSource2 = case(
    LogSource1 has "Admin-AD FS", "ADFS-Admin",
    LogSource1 == "Application-Microsoft-Windows-AppModel-State", "Application-AppModel-State",
    LogSource1 == "Application-Microsoft-Windows-CAPI2", "Application-CAPI2",
    LogSource1 == "Application-Microsoft-Windows-COMRuntime", "Application-COMRuntime",
    LogSource1 == "Application-Microsoft-Windows-Defrag", "Application-Defrag",
    LogSource1 == "Application-Microsoft-Windows-Perflib", "Application-Perflib",
    LogSource1 == "Application-Microsoft-Windows-PerfNet", "Application-PerfNet",
    LogSource1 == "Application-Microsoft-Windows-PerfOS", "Application-PerfOS",
    LogSource1 == "Application-Microsoft-Windows-PerfProc", "Application-PerfProc",
    LogSource1 == "Application-Microsoft-Windows-Security-SPP", "Application-Security-SPP",
    LogSource1 == "Application-Microsoft-Windows-WMI", "Application-WMI",
    LogSource1 == "Directory Service-Microsoft-Windows-ActiveDirectory_DomainService", "Directory Service-AADS",
    LogSource1 has "Microsoft-Windows-PowerShell", "PowerShell-Operational",
    LogSource1 has "Microsoft-Windows-Windows Defender", "Windows Defender-Antivirus",
    LogSource1 has "Microsoft-Windows-Windows Firewall With Advanced Security", "Windows Firewall-Advanced Security",
    LogSource1=="System-Microsoft-Windows-Bits-Client", "System-Bits-Client",
    LogSource1=="System-Microsoft-Windows-DistributedCOM", "System-DistributedCOM",
    LogSource1=="System-Microsoft-Windows-Kernel-Power", "System-Kernel-Power",
    LogSource1=="System-Microsoft-Windows-WindowsUpdateClient", "System-WindowsUpdateClient",
    LogSource1=="Windows PowerShell-PowerShell", "PowerShell-Windows", "xxx")
| extend LogSource = iff(LogSource2=="xxx", LogSource1, LogSource2)
| summarize count() by tostring(LogSource), LogSource1
| project LogSource, Count=count_, LogSource1
| sort by Count
content.title: Log Filter
content.noDataMessage: Select a workspace above to list accounts

| project tostring(Description)

| sort by Count

content.query:
let ServicePrincipalName = {SourceTable} | where ServicePrincipalName in (dynamic([{ServicePrincipalName}]));
let ResourceDisplayName = {SourceTable} | where ResourceDisplayName in (dynamic([{ResourceDisplayName}]));
let IPAddress = {SourceTable} | where IPAddress in (dynamic([{IPAddress}]));
let Location = {SourceTable} | extend LocationD = todynamic(LocationDetails) 
| extend Location = strcat(LocationD.countryOrRegion, "-", LocationD.city) 
| where Location in (dynamic([{Location}]));
union kind=inner isfuzzy=true
(ServicePrincipalName), (ResourceDisplayName), (IPAddress), (Location)
| extend ss = todynamic(AuthenticationProcessingDetails)
| extend cc = todynamic(LocationDetails)
| extend Type = ss[0].key
| extend City = cc.city
| extend State = cc.state
| extend Latitude = parse_json(tostring(cc.geoCoordinates)).latitude
| extend Longitude = parse_json(tostring(cc.geoCoordinates)).longitude
| project TimeGenerated, ServicePrincipalName, ResourceDisplayName, Type, IPAddress, Country=Location, City, State, Latitude, Longitude
| sort by TimeGenerated
| take 2000

let Identity = {SourceTable} | where Identity in (dynamic([{Identity}]));
let Result = {SourceTable} | where ResultDescription in (dynamic([{ResultDescription}]));
let AppDisplayName = {SourceTable} | where AppDisplayName in (dynamic([{AppDisplayName}]));
let AuthenticationRequirement = {SourceTable} | where AuthenticationRequirement in (dynamic([{AuthenticationRequirement}]));
let IPAddress = {SourceTable} | where IPAddress in (dynamic([{IPAddress}]));
let Location = {SourceTable} | extend LocationD = todynamic(LocationDetails) 
| extend Location = strcat(LocationD.countryOrRegion, "-", LocationD.city) 
| where Location in (dynamic([{Location}]));
union kind=inner isfuzzy=true
(Identity), (Result), (AppDisplayName), (AuthenticationRequirement), (IPAddress), (Location)
| extend DeviceDetail = todynamic(DeviceDetail)
| extend Browser = todynamic(DeviceDetail.browser)
| extend LocationDetails = todynamic(LocationDetails)
| extend State = LocationDetails.state
| extend City = LocationDetails.city
| extend AuthDetails = todynamic(AuthenticationProcessingDetails)
| extend A1 = AuthDetails[0].key
| extend A2 = AuthDetails[1].key
| extend A3= AuthDetails[2].key
| extend Latitude = parse_json(tostring(LocationDetails.geoCoordinates)).latitude
| extend Longitude = parse_json(tostring(LocationDetails.geoCoordinates)).longitude
| project TimeGenerated, Identity, UserPrincipalName, Country=Location, State, City, AppDisplayName, ClientAppUsed, Browser, ConditionalAccessStatus, IPAddress,  AuthenticationRequirement, ResourceDisplayName, RiskState, Latitude, Longitude, A1, A2, A3
| sort by TimeGenerated
| take 2000

content.json:
**Security Alert Viewer**. The initial set of tiles represents top alert and incident activity. The first tile displays the **alert-to-incident ratio**. This is a good indicator of alert aggregation. A low or near 1:1 ratio is an indicator of insufficient alert aggregation.

For Alert and Incident table analysis, start by selecting a timespan and one or more tables. Each selection is **cumulative**. **Best if you select from 1-2 filter categories at a time.**

parameters.name: ShowTop
parameters.label: Show Top Tiles
parameters.description: Turn off the top results tiles

content.query:
SecurityAlert
| summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated, *) by SystemAlertId
| summarize count() by bin(TimeGenerated, 1h), ProductName
| project TimeGenerated, Source=ProductName, Count=count_
content.title: Hourly Alerts by Source  - Time Brush Event Filter
content.noDataMessage: Select a Wokspace above to activate

content.query:
let Alert = SecurityAlert
| extend Source = iif(ProductName == "Azure Sentinel", "Sentinel", "External") 
| summarize count() by Source
| project Source, Alerts=count_;
let Incident = SecurityIncident
| extend Source = iif(ProviderName == "Azure Sentinel", "Sentinel", "External")
| summarize count() by Source
| project Source, Incidents=count_;
Alert
| join (Incident) on Source
| project Source, Alerts, Incidents, Ratio = strcat(round(toreal(Alerts)/toreal(Incidents),1), " : 1")
content.title: Alert-to-Incident Ratio

tooltipFormat.tooltip: Low ratio indicates poor alert aggregation

content.json:
**Agent Health Viewer**. The following workbooks shows agent health for connected Linux and Windows agents. Optional extension to view Defender for Cloud and Defender for Endpoint status. **Time range must exceed the threshold value.**

Requirement: At least one connected agent. Optional MDFC sharig the same workspace. Optional MDE integration. Based on Heartbeat, Update, and DeviceInfo tables.

parameters.name: MDFC
parameters.label: Shared MDFC?
parameters.description: Do Senitnel and MDFC share the same workspace?

parameters.name: MDE
parameters.label: MDE Integrated?
parameters.description: Are your MDE logs streamed to Sentinel?

content.query:
union isfuzzy=true
(SecurityEvent),(DnsEvents),(Event) 
| summarize count() by bin(TimeGenerated, 1h), Computer
| render timechart
content.title: Hourly Events by Agent
content.noDataMessage: Select a Wokspace above to activate

content.query:
let MDFC = Update
| extend ResourceId = iif(isempty(ResourceId), Computer, ResourceId)
| summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated, *) by Computer
| extend MDFC = iif(TimeGenerated < ago({Threshold:grain}),"⚫","🟢")
| project MDFC, Agent=ResourceId, LastSeen=TimeGenerated, Computer=tolower(Computer), Type;
let Sentinel = Heartbeat
| extend ResourceId = iif(isempty(ResourceId), Computer, ResourceId)
| extend Type = iif(Category == "Direct Agent", "Extension", "MMA Direct")
| summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated, *) by ResourceId
| extend UP = iif(TimeGenerated < ago({Threshold:grain}),"⚫","🟢")
| project UP, Agent=ResourceId, LastSeen=TimeGenerated, Computer=tolower(Computer), Type;
Sentinel
| join kind=leftouter MDFC on Computer
| project LastSeen, UP, Agent, Type, MDFC, Computer
| sort by LastSeen
content.title: Sentinel Agent Health
content.noDataMessage: Select one or more vendor source

content.json:
The **Security Audit Assessment** attempts to verify your Windows Security Audit Policy based on the event IDs collected. Windows Security Events are primarily the result of audit policy. This workbook can help to identify noisy policy configurations and potential audit gaps. [Windows Audit Policy Documentation]( https://docs.microsoft.com/windows/security/threat-protection/auditing/security-auditing-overview)

**Active Audit Policies** compares collected events with known audit policies. Review this to help idenfy unwanted policy-based event creation or collection.

**Inactive Audit Policies** shows policies that have no matching events. Either these policies are disabled or the related activity is infrequent. Note that any alert rules based on these events would be ineffective if the underlying policy is disabled.

let Active = SecurityEvent | summarize count() by EventID;
AuditRef
| join kind = fullouter (Active) on EventID
| extend Count = count_-1
| where Count > 0 and isnotempty(Policy)
| sort by Policy asc, Description asc
| project Policy, Description, PolicyLevel, Type=Impact, Filter=Group, EventID, Count
content.title: Active Audit Policies - Based on EventIDs Collected (90 Days)

let Active = SecurityEvent | where TimeGenerated >= ago(90d) | summarize count() by EventID;
AuditRef
| join  kind=fullouter (Active) on EventID
| extend Count = count_-1
| where isempty(EventID1)
| sort by Policy asc, Description asc
| project Policy, Description, PolicyLevel, Type=Impact, Filter=Group, EventID, Count=0
content.title: Inactive Audit Policies - Based on EventIDs Collected (90 Days)
